intro: Babingtonia camphorosmae, commonly known as the camphorosma babingtonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, sandy soils. Babingtonia camphorosmae is also valued for its aromatic foliage and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
